definition: adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)

sentences.english: Re-arming capacity is a significant factor in sortie generation rate.
sentences.chinese: 重新裝彈能力對於出勤率而言是一個重要影響因素。

sentences.english: I showed her how to break the barrel and put shells in.
sentences.chinese: 我向她演示如何打開槍管和裝彈上膛。

sentences.english: Machine Gunner's sight range reduced by 500 during reload.
sentences.chinese: 重型機槍兵在重裝彈時將會降低500的視野。

sentences.english: It is very difficult to judge fault reason quickly and accurately when autoloader has troubles.
sentences.chinese: 自動裝彈機發生故障時很難快速準確地判斷故障原因。

sentences.english: Such weapons can fire ammunition quickly, without the shooter having to reload.
sentences.chinese: 這種武器可以快速發射彈藥而無需槍手重新裝彈。

sentences.english: It is not very fast and its reload rate is slower for most other tanks.
sentences.chinese: 它比普通的坦克慢並且裝彈速度也不快。
